news politics who-cressida-dicks-partner-first-"Cressida Dick resigns as Met Police CommissionerByBenjamin LynchTrends Writer:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |commentsDame Cressida Dick has resigned as head of the politan Police, mere hours after a bullish defence saying she was going nowhere. The London police force has faced a number of scandals and dficult moments under Dickaposs tenure, and Mayor of London Sadiq Khan said he was not satisfied the -year-old was the person to take it forward amid a loss in confidence in the force. Public fury was raised over the Sarah Everard case, in which a young woman was raped and murdered by serving Met police officer Wayne Couzens, and WhatsApp texting scandals that showed both misogynistic and racist attitudes from officers serving on the force.The Mayor said: It’s clear that the only way to start to deliver the scale of the change required is to have new leadership right at the top of the politan Police.  Dick said it was with huge sadness that she is stepping back after taking the role in .The first openly gay commissioner of the Met will stay on in the role until a new head is found. Who is Cressida Dickaposs partner   Very little is known about Dickaposs private le, but her partner is a now retired Met inspector known only as Helen.Dick told the Daily Mail in : She was a duty inspector in a busy London borough. It was a big, demanding job — she loved it and I am biased, of course, but she was really good at it.In what was a landmark moment, Dick became not just the first woman in the Metaposs top job, but the forceaposs first openly gay serving commissioner in .  Speaking on Desert Island Discs in , Dick claimed that one of the least interesting things about her is her sexuality. She said: Sometimes people say to me that they think it’s important, but to be honest, for me, I think it’s one of the least interesting things about me. Despite this, many in the LGBTQIA+ community saw her appointment as a signicant step on the road for promoting equality of people from all backgrounds, genders and sexualities. Why has Cressida Dick resigned   The Met has faced repeated dficulties, culminating in a concerning perception of serving officers. Among other scandals, the abduction, rape and murder of Sarah Everard, and the subsequently controversial dealing of a vigil held in Clapham marking her death, were met with public outcry. Members of the public voiced their concerns about serving police officers - not helped by the most recent scandal of her tenure, in which an investigation by the Independent Office for Police Conduct found vile misogynistic messages on WhatsApp and Facebook messenger groups held by Charing Cross police officers. Chats saw them joke about slapping your missus about and calling women daft c**ts for getting murdered by their partners. The Met was also accused of a aposstitch-upapos - which it denied - regarding the handling of the Number  Partygate scandals after it emerged a senior officer overseeing complaints about Partygate is the brother of Health Secretary Sajid Javid.Dame Cressida acknowledged the Metaposs failings in her statement, which said: The murder of Sarah Everard and many other awful cases recently have, I know, damaged confidence in this fantastic police service. There is much to do – and I know that the Met has turned its full attention to rebuilding public trust and confidence. title: artist behind marcus rashford mural
story: Artist behind Marcus Rashford mural shares artwork painted for new puppy cafeStreet artist Akse P produced portraits of six pups to celebrate the opening of the pop-up Puppy Love Café at Cheshire Oaks Designer Outlet ahead of Valentine’s DayStreet artist AKSE P created six amazing murals of Cheshire puppies Image: McArthurGlen Designer Outlet Cheshire OaksByNia DaltonSpecialist Writer:,  Feb |comments The artist behind the famous Marcus Rashford mural, Akse P, has created some pawsome new art to celebrate the opening of a brand new puppy cafe.The Mancunian street artist has previously produced a mural of late Joy Division frontman Ian Curtis, as well as tributes to David Bowie, George Floyd and Captain Sir Tom Moore.Now heaposs created an original mural design of six pups - making it the picture-perfect spot to take yourdogfor a bite to eat.Artist Akse said: “The response to the dog mural competition has been a great success, people have posted some fantastic photos of their canine soulmates, it’s really been fun to make this mural come to le.”to ourTeamDogs newsletterfor your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.The artwork was unveiled ahead of the grand opening of the cafe in Bakers  Baristas on February  at Cheshire Oaks Designer Outlet on Valentine’s Day. On the brightly coloured wall, you can spot miniature dachshund Oscar, labradoodle Dobby, bassett hound Basil, terrier Cooper, miniature poodle Snoop and cocker spaniel Hattie. The cafe will be open from February -. Guests can bring their furry soulmate along for some puppy love and handmade patisserie-style snacks, made with natural ingredients.For just £., doggy dates can get a hot drink, human cake, puppuccino and doggie doughnut. Kenny Murray, the general manager, said: “It’s no doubt that we are a nation of dog lovers, and here at Cheshire Oaks Designer Outlet we adore seeing all of the beautul dogs brought into the Centre. We are delighted to be able to give visitors the opportunity to enjoy a relaxing day out with their four-legged friend in tow, whether it’s admiring the brand-new mural by Akse P, or stopping off for a pup-friendly pastry at the Puppy Love Café.”Do you have dog story to share  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON TeamDogsDogsAnimalsFoodMarcus RashfordPuppy LoveDesigner Outlet" data-immediate"data-immediate"Calling all dog lovers!to TeamDogs for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.Invalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: british man 25 denies travelling
story: British man, , denies travelling to Syria to join Islamic State during family holidayShabbazz Suleman, , from northwest London, allegedly crossed into Syria in  to join Islamic State fighters. He was arrested at Heathrow Airport last year and charged under the Terrorism ActShabbazz Suleman denied travelling to Syria to join IS fighters Image: The TAB   SWNSByAntony ThrowerNews Reporter:,  Feb  A British terror suspect has denied travelling to Syria to join Islamic State fighters.Shabazz Suleman, from northwest London, allegedly crossed into the war-torn country to join the militant terrorist group during a family holiday to Turkey in . The -year-old was arrested at Heathrow Airport on September  last year and charged under the Terrorism Act. The former grammar school pupil, of Freemantle Road, High Wycombe, Buckinghamshire, faces charges of preparing for acts of terrorism, being a member of a proscribed organisation and receiving weapons training. He appeared at the Old Bailey on Friday via video link from Belmarsh Prison dressed in a grey suit and yellow tie and denied all charges.  Kathryn Selby, prosecuting, earlier said: The prosecutionaposs case is that back in  Mr Selby left the UK, he went on a family trip to Turkey which we say he crossed to travel to Syria in order to join what is know as the Islamic State. Judge Mark Lucraft said: The trial is fixed on the  September at this court before me, and I have made ious directions at this hearing which has been a preparatory hearing and the defendant has been arraigned. Suleman denies all three charges. He has been remanded in custody ahead of a further hearing at the same court on May .Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Heathrow AirportTerrorismSyria" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: buckingham palace launches 39 bottle
story: Buckingham Palace launches £ bottle of royal bubbly to mark Queen’s Platinum JubileeThe fizz is being sold by the Royal Collection Trust, which said the drink can be enjoyed as an aperit and goes well with the flavour of mature English cheddarThe Royal Collection Trust says the fizz goes well with the flavour of mature English cheddar Image: Anadolu Agency via Getty ImagesByLouie SmithNews Reporter:,  Feb |commentsHere’s one way to put a bit of sparkle into your celebrations for the Queen’s Platinum Jubilee… Buckingham Palace has launched a £ special edition English bottle of bubbly to mark her  years on the throne. The fizz is a blend of chardonnay, pinot noir and pinot meunier from vineyards in Kent and West Sussex. It is being sold by the Royal Collection Trust, which said the drink can be enjoyed as an aperit and goes well with the flavour of mature English cheddar. The RCT added: “It also complements British seafood, such as crab, langoustines or classic fish and chips, making the wine a perfect addition to the Queen’s Platinum Jubilee ­celebrations this summer.” With a % alcohol content, the tipple is said to have “enticing aromas of rich and honeyed citrus fruit, white peach and hints of sweet spices”.  Matching hand-cut champagne glasses are also on sale at a cost of £ a pair. All profits from sales will go to The RCT charity, which oversees the conservation of the Royal Collection. On February , the Queen became the first British monarch to celebrate a ­Platinum Jubilee. Now fans can toast her with their very own royal bubbly. title: cheeky landlord slammed expecting tenants
story: Cheeky landlord slammed for expecting tenants to bring their own floor when they move inThe property, in Littleboroough, Greater Manchester, has bare flooring in the lounge and bedroom and untreated wooden stairs and also appears to have just basic tiles in the bathroom and kitchenThe property has no few floor coverings Image: Andrew Kelly estate RightmoveByAndy CrickGraeme Murray:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |commentsA cheeky landlord has been slammed for expecting a tenant to bring their own floor when they move in. The tiny, one-bedroom end-of-terrace is on the market for £-per-month. But photos reveal that there are no carpets throughout the pad. There is bare flooring in the lounge and bedroom and untreated wooden stairs. The pad in Littleborough, near Rochdale, Greater Manchester, also appears to have just basic tiles in the bathroom and kitchen. A listing for the property read: Please be aware the property is let unfurnished and any successful applicant would be expected to put their own flooring in.  Actress Angela Hazeldine fumed when she saw it. The -year-old is currently looking for a property to rent. Angela said: Just looking at flats to rent and one of them says flat is aposunfurnishedapos renter would be expected to aposput own flooring inapos. Thataposs not a thing surely. She also tweeted Rightmove - which is promoting it for Andrew Kelly estate agents - and said: Rightmove how is this allowed   The landlord basically wants you to pay their mortgage and carpet their entire house. On what planet is this acceptable  Mick Cooper added: Thataposs hilarious. I hopesomeone moves in, they take the floor with them when they leave. Landlord is a chancer. Nia Jones joked in response: P**s artists.  The property, which has since been taken off the Rightmoveaposs website, boasts that it is well appointed and in a sought after residential location. It also says it is near shops and close to the open countryside and has gas central heating and double glazing. But potential renters were astonished the landlord had not included a floor in the listing and others joked they would take one with them when they left.  The rest of the listing reads: Available now, no pets. Andrew Kellyaposs are delighted to offer for let this very well appointed stone end terraced situated in a sought after residential location on the doorstep of Littleborough village, shops, Hollingworth Lake and open countryside. Comprising vestibule, lounge, modern galley style kitchen, one first floor bedroom and box room which is ideally suited to office space and shower room WC. Benefits include gas central heating, double glazing and private rear yard. A spokesman for Rightmove confirmed the property listing had been taken down, stating: This listing has been removed from Rightmove.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Rightmoveproperty news" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts from our Property Market newsletterSubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: couple left terrified after returning
story: Couple left terried after ing to find builders had blocked their home with wallJohn Gridley, , says it is "impossible" to push -year-old we Mavis wheelchair through the small gap the "ruthless" developer has left at their cottage in Devon - so the couple have moved outJohn and Mavis Gridley say they have been forced to leave their home because of the ruthless developer Image: Dan Charity   Newsgroup Newspapers LtdBySam Elliott-GibbsReporter:,  Feb |comments An elderly couple say they have been left intimidated and locked out of their home after builders put up a wall blocking their path while they were out seeing friends.John Gridley, , and his wheelchair-bound we Mavis, , say they were left terried after ing to their cottage in Bridgerule, Devon. They say a developer built the wall cutting across their entrance and now they canapost access their property. John claims it is no longer possible to get Mavisapos wheelchair through the tiny gap that has been left so they have moved out. The couple have lived at the end-of-terrace for more than  years and say they have been left shaken by their ordeal.Things got so bad that they had to bed a neighbour to climb in and pick up some essentials because they are too scared to . John told The Sun that his suspicions grew the day before when a car neither of them recognised was parked on their drive.They claim ruthless local developer Lee Lipscombe and his work force came mobhanded and begun ripping down the fence outside the next morning. The pensioner said: Weaposve had this house for  years. It really frightened us. We were totally intimidated.  Iaposm an ex-policeman and I was absolutely shaking. My le has been shattered. Weaposre both elderly, my we is in her s, and weaposve simply got to have access to our own home. There is nowhere near enough room for pedestrian and wheelchair access. He added that there is just a bare metre from the edge of the wall to the edge of the cottage. has made attempts to contact Mr Lipscombe for comment. They were so upset by what happened they moved back to their second home in Ashford, Surrey. The area outside their property where the wall was built was purchased by the developer in .The couple confirmed they have referred the matter to the parish council and Devon and Cornwall Police. But legal experts say the developer could face courtthe Gridleys decide to take legal action. Christopher Bernard, partner at Housing  Property Law Partnership Solicitors, said: If you go into your house, or anywhere, for more than  years then you simply have a right of way. They could take Mr Lipscombe to county court to get an order saying the wall should be knocked down. title: dad who giant 10lb tumour
story: Dad who had giant lb tumour removed dies suddenly in sleep leaving family devastatedWARNING: GRAPHIC IMAGE Kevin ONeil, , passed away following a long battle with the incredibly rare disease which only  people in the world haveIll health had taken its toll on Kevins body, but his death came out of the blue for his devastated family Image: Daily RecordByGemma RyderJoe Smith:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments A dad-of-two who had a gigantic tumour weighing lb removed from his back has died suddenly in his sleep.Kevin OaposNeil, , was one of just  people on the planet to have the condition, called Myopericytoma, a cancer of the soft tissues. Kevin, from Inverkeithing, had spent a decade battling pain before doctors discovered he had the rare disease. In  he underwent an extraordinary operation to remove the monster tumour.A team of  surgeons removed the gigantic mass in an amazing -hour operation. The mammoth procedure allowed former union organsier Kevin to see his two boys Jack, , and Nathan, , grow up. Treatments for benign tumors saw doctors taking out six of Kevin’s ribs, two-thirds of his shoulder blade, moving muscle from his lower back, and rebuilding his chest - all of which left him suffering from chronic pain, reports the Daily Record.Ill health had taken its toll on Kevinaposs body, but his death came out of the blue for his devastated family. His we Kirsty found his body on Saturday morningand a post-mortem is now taking place.Hi son Jack told the Record: It seems so out of the blue. My dad has been really ill at dferent points in the last  years but it wasnapost anything like that, he just died in his sleep suddenly. There had been a lot of times when my step-mum Kirsty called to say she had taken him to the hospital and I thought his passing was imminent. He struggled a lot but even when I saw him a couple of weeks ago he seemed well. But everything that he had gone through had taken a toll on his body. Weaposre just thankful he died peacefully. I donapost think people realise just how bad the chronic pain was he had to live with. He picked up my brother every day from school and was always busy organising fundraisers - he did so much even when he was ill. He was my hero and Iaposve never seen such courage. Kevin’s health problems began in  when he was training for a charity cycle from Land’s End to John O’ Groats. And despite having to medically retire from his role at Unison, he continued with fundraising efforts for Maggieaposs Macmillian cancer and Sarcoma, including staging a music festival.With a passion for politics, he was one of the youngest candidates in the country to stand for local election when he was  for the Labour, before joining the SNP and running for selection with the party.He also was one of the founders of the campaign group aposAction for Prestonhillapos after his brother died in an accident at the Inverkeithing quarry in . Tributes have poured in from across Scotland including prominent politicians such SNP Westminster leader Ian Blackford MP. Thinking of you and your family, Jack. So sorry for your loss, he said. Dunfermline and West Fe MP Douglas Chapman said: So, so sad to hear this news. Kevin was an inspiration to all who had the privilege to know him. Thinking of Kirsty, Nathan, Jack and all family and friends. RIP Big Man.  Jack added: My dad really was an amazing guy - I canapost believe the number of people from all walks of le who have been in touch saying he touched their lives. He was an extraordinary man who dedicated much of his le to helping others. He always told me how proud he was of me, I just hope he knew how proud I was of him. In the face of a horric rare illness, invasive and traumatic treatments, and unrelenting chronic pain he did his utmost to act as a pillar of strength for our family, raise my -year-old brother, Nathan, and be an amazing Dad to us both. He’s left a massive hole. title: female burglar no remorse sticks
story: Female burglar with no remorse sticks tongue out in cheeky mugshotUnrepentant Cleo ODonnell, , from Worcester, stuck her tongue out at the camera as she posed for her police mugshot - but now she has started an eight-year prison stretch for the violent robberyCleo ODonnell pleaded guilty to carrying out two armed raids in WorcesterByJane TylerSam Elliott-GibbsReporter:,  Feb |comments A brazen burglar who poked out her tongue in a police mugshot has now been jailed for her crimes.Shameless Cleo OaposDonnell, , appeared carefree after being being taken into custody in Worcester.She made the gesture after being arrested for the violent robbery, BirminghamLive reportThe criminal broke into a house with accomplice Anthony Hannay and were both armed with weapons. Now the pair are back behind bars after being jailed for their latest crime last month. Police quickly established who the suspects were and arrested OaposDonnell and Hannay shortly afterwards.Enquiries later revealed that a second aggravated burglary had taken place where the occupant sustained an injury. O’Donnell and Hannay, , both pleaded guilty to two charges of aggravated burglary and one charge of  imprisonment.They were remanded in custody and were sentenced at Worcester Crown Court on February . OaposDonnell received a seven-year jail term, while Hannay was jailed for eight years. It is not the first OaposDonnell has made headlines.  In June last year, she was named by cops as she was wanted for recall to prison while awaiting sentencing for stealing a car. She was facing a prison term in November  after pleading guilty to taking a car without the owner’s consent, driving otherwise than in accordance with a licence and driving without insurance. The court heard how OaposDonnell, who was pregnant at the time, had a long history of drug and alcohol misuse. Her lawyers at the time argued that OaposDonnell was the victim of domestic violence. Last February, Anthony Hannay, also went on the run - but was eventually found hiding in the attic of a house in Worcester.Whilst on the run, Hannay appeared to be taunting officers by posting comments on the Facebook appeals West Mercia Police was making in their bid to find him.Someone using his name goaded them, with comments like: Catch meyou can and Just cooking my steak so come after. news uk-news five-frontrunners-could-replace-cressida-"Cressida Dick resigns as Met Police CommissionerByAbigail OLearyNews Reporter:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments The speculated frontrunners to replace Cressida Dick have been named as families of those felt let down by the Met Police blast the departing Commissioner. Dame Cressida announced on Thursday she would be stepping down after losing the backing of London Mayor Sadiq Khan in the wake of a series of scandals during her tenure leading. London Mayor Sadiq Khan said he was not satisfied Dame Cressida could root out the racism, sexism, homophobia, bullying, discrimination and misogyny that still exist in the force or restore Londonersapos trust.Dame Cressida acknowledged the Metaposs failings in her statement, which said: “The murder of Sarah Everard and many other awful cases recently have, I know, damaged confidence in this fantastic police service. There is much to do – and I know that the Met has turned its full attention to rebuilding public trust and confidence.”Describing her decision to resign, she said: “It is with huge sadness that following contact with the Mayor of London today, it is clear that the Mayor no longer has sufficient confidence in my leadership to continue. He has left me no choice but to step aside as Commissioner of the politan Police Service. The mayor and Home Secretary Priti Patel will now begin the search for a new Commissioner.Without a clear frontrunner to replace the outgoing commissioner, here is a look at some of the likely candidates Neil Basu  Neil Basu, another assistant commissioner who previously worked as the head of counter-terrorism, is thought to be a likely candidate. Mr Basu has spent his entire career serving in the politan Police.In a  interview with , he said thatsomeone used the racially offensive comments Boris Johnson had, they would not be admitted into the police force.For some, the comments were seen as political and could prove detrimental to his chances of succeeding Dame Cressida. But Mr Basu is popular among officers and is still widely seen as capable. He is also the most senior police officer of Asian heritage and would be the first minority ethnic commissioner.Matt Jukes  Matt Jukes, an assistant politan Police commissioner currently working as head of counter-terrorism, is seen by many commentators as a likely contender.Mr Jukes first joined South Yorkshire Police as a Pc before moving to South Wales Police and working his way up the ranks.He rose to become chief constable of South Wales Police before ing to the politan Police as an assistant commissioner in . So unlike Dame Cressida, who never ran her own force before becoming commissioner, he has prior experience at the helm. Sir Stephen House  Sir Stephen House is the Deputy Commissioner of the politan Police, just below Dame Cressida, and so is a natural contender for the job.The Scottish police officer has worked in several dferent forces and was appointed chief constable of Police Scotland in .However, during his tenure leading Police Scotland he faced criticism for his use of armed patrols as well as stop and search. He eventually resigned in  over the deaths of Lamara Bell and John Yuill, who lay undiscovered in a wrecked car for three days despite a call from a member of the public. But in , he became an assistant commissioner at the politan Police and was promoted to deputy commissioner by the end of the year.Lucy DaposOrsi Current Chief Constable of the British Transport Police, Lucy previously worked as a senior officer at the politan Police. During her career, she was in charge of the police response to the Beaufort Park fire in  and she headed up security during Chinese leader Xi Jinpingaposs visit to the UK in .She would be following in Dame Cressidaaposs footsteps as the second woman to become politan Police commissioner. Nick Ephgrave  Nick Ephgrave, assistant commissioner for frontline policing, is also in with a chance of getting the top job.Mr Ephgrave began his career at the politan Police but moved to become chief constable of Surrey Police in late .In , he ed to the politan Police as an assistant commissioner. Like Mr Jukes, he also already has experience leading a police force. Families of those failed by the Met Police have also spoken out since Cressida Dickaposs announcement to step down. The brother of Stephen Lawrence, who was killed in a racially motivated attack in , has said the politan Police commissioneraposs resignation was needed and it has set the police on a pathway now of seeing real change. Speaking to BBC Breakfast, Stuart Lawrence said: I have met her a good couple of times and those meetings always have been productive, she has always come across to me personally as someone who wants to implement change and wants to see things done dferently, but she just hasnapost been able to really put that down to the rest of the forces and the people who are responsible for the dferent teams throughout the politan Police force.Its a big service, thereaposs lots of dferent members and lots of dferent moving parts and itaposs a big job and we really need someone thataposs going to be put in post now thataposs going really to be able to stamp a real clean step of a new direction to go in. Ricky Waumsley, whose partner Daniel Whitworth was murdered by serial killer Stephen Port, said he didnapost have much faith in Dame Cressida Dick when he met her just before Christmas. He said he welcomed her resignation as she definitely needed to go. Outlining his meeting with the former Met chief after an inquest into the deaths of Portaposs victims concluded in December, Mr Waumsley told the Today programme on BBC Radio : It went OK. She came across [as] friendly and she said she was going to look into improving the Met Police, but I didnapost really have much faith in her.  Explaining why, he said it was due to a combination of the scale of what had happened and because of that meeting. Thereaposs so much homophobic, sexist and racist stuff going on within the Met Police right now. I donapost think she is capable of sorting out these issues, he said. He said he is calling for an investigation into the officers who handled the case to be reopened. Last year, Assistant Commissioner Helen Ball issued an apology on behalf of the Met but rejected the claim that homophobia played a part in its investigation into Port. news uk-news golden-retrievers-adorable-valentines-day-"Golden Retriever adorably asks for Valentine applicationsByPaige FreshwaterContent Editor:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments An adorable golden retriever has opened applications for a ‘special lady’ to be his Valentine.Waiting in his very own ‘love booth’, Whisky has set out his requirements for a four-legged partner, saying they must ‘love adventure, swimming, cuddles and treats’,On Instagram, his message reads: “Heck friends am wee bit last minute Larry over ere plz I’m lookin for V special lady to be my date dis Valentine’s.“I show u gd time not safe time and share all ma treatos. Pls apply withinda shoe fits ur paw.” Claire Cunningham, from Ayrshire, Scotland, is the owner behind the two-year-old dog’s adorable Instagram page, which has racked in almost , followers. to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories. Responding to his application, one user said: “Where do I sign up Whisky ” While another wrote: “I show u gd time not safe time Whisky,” and a third said: “This is adorable. I’d love to be your Valentine but a lady, I am not.” Since welcoming Whisky into the family in July , Claire has shared countless pictures and videos of her adorable dog on social media. She said: “The videos are generally just so easy - he is forever doing things that make me laugh. “Even the way he has made a dent on the back of my armchair because of the way he has to sit with his chin on the windowsill and paws on the radiator is just signature Whisky. “I have so many videos of him just being him and when I find the right audio it just seems to fit.”Claire turned to Whisky for companionship and entertainment during the first Covid- lockdown - and wanted to share him with the world.“Whisky was eight-months-old when we went into the first lockdown and I know it sounds cliche but with me working from home, he was literally what got me through,” said Claire.  “I spend every minute I can with him and on the weekends I’m very much ‘ my dog can’t come I’m not going’. “He fills our days with love and laughter and seems to have made quite an impression on his followers as we get loads of messages every week from his fans around the world.” Whisky has been described as “the most mischievous dog out there” who loves being the centre of attention. She added: “He is always up to something whether it’s stealing hats off peopleaposs heads or deliberately pushing his tennis balls under the sofa and barking at it until he gets your attention. “He is also so endearing and has to speak to everybody he walks by - the feeling seems mutual with everyone wanting to speak to him as well though. “If walking up the street and a car stops at a junction he always stops, sits and wags his tail thinking the car has stopped and someone will be getting out to speak to him.“He lives le to the fullest, desperate for adventure in whatever weather there is but is also so full of love and enjoys being cuddled up with his humans.” Do you have a cute dog story to sell  Email paige.freshwater@reachplc.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON TeamDogsAnimalsDogsLoveValentines Day" data-immediate"data-immediate"Calling all dog lovers!to TeamDogs for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.Invalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: groom slammed attending wedding bride
story: Groom slammed for attending own wedding to bride, , in jeans and T-shirtBest friend of the bride, Violet Price, , from Doncaster, shared a now-infamous clip on TikTok, showing bride Catherine Nicholson getting married to her casually-attired groomSocial media users have taken issue with the apparent lack of effort behind the mystery groom’s choice of attireByPhoebe Tonks:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |commentsA groom who turned up for his wedding in a pair of jeans and a t-shirt with a slogan across the front has prompted widespread criticism. Some critics have even askedhe “even knew he was getting married”. TikTok user Violet Price, , shared a now-infamous clip on the , showing her glamorous best friend Catherine Nicholson getting married to her casually-attired groom.According to Yorkshire Live reports, the clip has received more than . million views.Many social media users took issue with the apparent lack of effort behind the mystery groom’s choice of attire. For the celebratory occasion, the groom opted for a black t-shirt from the streetwear brand, Palm Angels, and paired it with grey washed jeans and trainers. His bride Catherine, , went for a more traditional approach and was pictured wearing a white mermaid style wedding gown, complete with cinched waist and a long lace train.  In the video, Catherine and Violet could be seen having fun on a fairground ride while Violet accompanied the footage with the caption: My best friend a couple of months ago telling me she ainapost gunna fall in love. In the accompanying audio, they can also both be heard chanting, I ainapost falling in love this summer, I do my thing this summer in the background, before the video cuts to Catherine on her wedding day, a mere two months later. Several social media users expressed their views too on the speed at which Catherine had taken the marital plunge, with many commenting that it seemed too short a time for such a serious commitment. One person said: Everyone talking about what heaposs wearing but Iaposm thinking how a couple of MONTHS before her wedding she didnapost wanna fall in love… Another suggested the images from the wedding day did not show a beaming bride, saying: Sheaposs not exactly giving happy in love vibes tbf. A third added: Okay but his outfit aside, sis donapost even look happy. Despite the whirlwind romance already drawing some critical comments, many users took more umbrage with the groom’s chosen outfit - and didn’t hold back when sharing their thoughts on the matter. One person asked: Did he not know he was getting married  Another joked: Wedding at . Wetherspoons with the ladsapos at . Noting the effort made by Catherine for the big day, a third said: aposI wouldaposve done a u-turn as soon as I saw him. Imagine putting all the effort into looking beautul  then your aposfiancéapos shows up like THAT  Violet, however, was accepting none of it and hit back at trolls that called into question her friend’s happiness by posting: For god sake stop, sheaposs married and very happy. title: i gave up job dog
story: ‘I gave up my job so me and my dog could have a better le’After Emma Filby and her dog were both diagnosed with arthritis, she made the le-changing decision to leave her full-time career and prioritise her health insteadEmma left her full-time career to give her and cocker spaniel Thea a better le Image: Daniel PalmerByNia DaltonSpecialist Writer:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments A woman has told how she ditched her job to ensure she could give herself and her dog a better le - after they were both diagnosed with arthritis.Emma Filby, based in Linton, Cambridgeshire, made the decision to leave her full-time career as a deputy manager at the University of Cambridge, and now she and her cocker spaniel Thea are “thriving”. While it was financially daunting, Emma is content with her new lestyle and says “no amount of money would make me happier than what I have now”. Emma adds: “It has given me the time and energy to focus on my and the dog’s well-being.”  to ourTeamDogs newsletterfor your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.Emma was working in an office when she was diagnosed with ankylosing spondylitistwo years ago. AS is a long-term inflammatory condition that causes her pain and stfness, as well as periods of chronic fatigue. While it can be managed with medication and movement, her job at the University of Cambridge required full-time commitment and sitting at a desk added to Emma’s pain. “My diagnosis came with a sense of loss of what I envisaged the future to be,” Emma said. Around the same time, Emma noticed something was wrong with her dog Thea.  “She started missing her jumps on the sofa and wanted to turn around and go home early on walks,” Emma said. Vets diagnosed Thea with mild arthritis, and together, the pair adapted to their new realities. A busy schedule made it dficult for her to take care of herself and find time to take Thea to her many appointments. The turning point for Emma was when she realised that she couldn’t reduce her working hours. “I applied to go part-time and I was declined because I was a manager. I couldn’t just clock off,” she explained. So, Emma left and found a new part-time job that allowed her more spare time and flexibility.  “Financially, it was daunting making the jump to leave my career but I felt my lestyle had to change,” Emma said. Now, Emma works three days a week compared to five days and doesnapost work weekends.She has continued to run and grow her dog training businessAnglian Dog Worksalongside her part-time role.“My new routine allows me to be responsive when my body needs resting,” Emma said. “I am so happy and grateful that I made the decision.” Emma enjoys horse riding and practising hot yoga in her newfound spare time, while Thea attends physio and hydrotherapy. Together, they like going for long daytime walks and doing lots of hiking in the UK. “At nine years old, Thea has never looked better!” Emma said. Emma is content with her new lestyle and says “what I earn is enough and we’re comfortable”. “I can’t imagine a salary good enough that would make me want to go back full-time,” she said.Do you have dog story to share  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON TeamDogsDogsAnimalsUniversity of CambridgeEducationTherapyArthritisPeriods" data-immediate"data-immediate"Calling all dog lovers!to TeamDogs for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.Invalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news i-visited-worlds-largest-greggs-"The Mirror visits worlds largest Greggs in the worlds biggest PrimarkByJulia BanimAudience Writer:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |commentsAs a keen bargain hunter, I’ve naturally heard tell of Birmingham’s famed Primark - the largest in the world no less - but have never had an excuse to visit.So you can imagine my delight upon learning that the store would now be home to the biggest Greggs on the planet. As reported last week, Greggs has teamed up with Primark for the very first time on a unique cafe experience and clothing range. The collab feels like a long overdue fit for the two high street legends, with Nottingham-based interior designer Philip Watts bringing a fun and energetic feel to whataposs been described as the most ‘Instagrammable Greggs in the world’.The doors to Tasty by Greggs officially open in Primarkaposs giant flagship store on Saturday, February . However, I was fortunate enough to get a sneak peek ahead of the launch, and feel I can now at long last officially add the role of apospasty influencerapos to my CV.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. Although the Tasty by Greggs cafe is far more than just your average Greggs, the menu will be very familiar to all Greggs fans, with all your favourite treats present and correct - nothing brand new or dferent being sold here.Seems a bit of a shame they didnapost decide to create a limited-edition Primark-themed doughnut or something with bright neon colours to match the playful interior. With nothing new on offer to tantalise my tastebuds, I opted for a trusty vegan sausage roll followed by a sugar strand doughnut, all washed down with a vanilla latte from the quirky self-serve coffee cart. Although I know not everyone is keen on self-service coffee, I personally enjoyed this aspect of the restaurant, which really does enhance the relaxed feel of the place. I can absolutely imagine nipping in for aposjust one coffeeapos before staying for three. As big as the cafe and host store are, the sausage rolls and doughnuts were unfortunately standard-sized, which was, admittedly, another small disappointment. However, it does mean thereaposs always room to eat more!  Being Northern, Iaposm more than happy queuing up at small Greggsapos chains during hurried lunch break runs. However, Tasty by Greggs brings a completely new dynamic to the beloved bakery experience that I didnapost even know I needed in my le until now.You will also still very much feel like you are in Greggs, albeit Greggs when looked at through an influencer-worthy Instagram filter. Tasty takes things to the next level, seating as many as  people in a spacious and above all very chilled-out space. However, despite its size, Tasty doesn’t have the sort of impersonal, hectic feel that a lot of large high street cafes have. Divided into distinct sections, Tasty has a fun, home-from-home feel, and you can absolutely imagine flopping down here with your shopping bags to st through new purchases at your leisure. Those wanting a summery feel in drizzly February can park themselves in the light and airy Greggs picnic area, which is fitted with picnic benches well-suited to weekend catch-ups over brews. Meanwhile, selfie lovers will be in their element, with the most ‘Instagrammable Greggs in the world’ certainly living up to its name.My personal favourite feature was the cute sprinkle doughnut swing, surrounded by neon signage and tailor-made to show off your latest Primark haul.I can imagine this will prove popular, so Iaposd definitely advise grabbing yourself a seat at one of the nearby half doughnut booths while you wait for it to free up.  Much like the chain thataposs kept Brits coming back again and again since , Tasty offers a friendly, welcoming experience, all while bringing something a little new and vibrant - itaposs the perfect accompaniment to any serious Primark shopping spree. Tasty by Greggs will open at Primark’s Birmingham store at . am on Saturday, February , and can be found between men’s and ladieswear on Primark’s - Mezzanine floor. Will you be visiting the worldaposs largest Greggs  Let us know in the comments below. title: luxury bungalow sale near sandringham
story: Luxury bungalow for sale near Sandringham- and the Queen will be YOUR neighbourFor under £ million, you can become the Queens neighbour for several weeks of the yearThe Queen and the Royal Family spend several weeks of the year at the Sandringham estate Image: POOL AFP via Getty ImagesByMichele Theil:,  Feb |commentsA luxury bungalow on the edge of Sandringham estate in Norfolk is up for sale, which means the lucky buyer could be neighbours with the Queen. The four-bedroom detached property in Hilington borders the , acre estate and is also close to Anmer Hall, the country home of the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge. The Royal Family spends several weeks of the year at the Sandringham estate, including Christmas. If you want the chance to catch a glimpse of the Royals during the festive season, all you have to do is shell out £, for the property. For that price, you get stylish glazed walls, a large back garden, and a view of St Mary the Virgin Church, where the Queen sometimes visits while in residence at Sandringham.  The property has been listed by estate agents Brown  Co who say the bungalow was built in the late s and is in superb order. They also say it is flooded with natural light from the clever architectural design and large windows.  The property has been giving planning permission to build a three bedroom detached house and garage at the end of the property, which could add £, to its value. The couple who are selling it has lived there for  years, have re-roofed it and carried out extensive renovations on the property in recent years. The kitchen is designed and fitted with quartz worktops and floor to ceiling glazed windows as well as sliding doors.There is a sitting room described as a stunning formal space and a reception hallway leading into an open plan dinning area and the kitchen breakfast room. A family room can be converted to a fth bedroomthe new owners have use of it, while the master bedroom has an en-suite shower room and sitting room so you can get a bit of quiet timeyou need it. The current owners use the sitting room as their study. There is a family bathroom, a laundry room, and access to a double garage, as youaposll need a car to get around the area.The bungalowaposs amazing location means you wonapost get much noise, particularly as it is set back from the road behind a wall and security gates. Itaposs in walking distance from a shop, a petrol station, a garage, a pub, and the Queen – what more could you need  Lee Shauardson from Brown  Co said: There is a lot of interest in the property because it appeals to quite a mixed bag of buyers. “There is some interest because of the building plot – but a lot of people just see it as a fantastic house in Norfolk, and in close proximity to the coast. Being next to Sandringham makes it even more attractive, he says. He added: Sandringham has beautul countryside and woodland, and there are plenty of areas which have public access.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Kate Middleton, Duchess of CambridgeRoyal FamilySandringham" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: man ends up trapped wilkos
story: Man ends up trapped in Wilkos all night after falling asleep in doorwayThe man, who was on a night out, became locked into the Wilkos branch after he fell asleep in the doorway and the shutters came downThe side entrance of the Wilko store - showing where the man had fallen asleep and was locked inByEmily Hall:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |commentsA man on a night out fell asleep in the doorway of a branch of Wilkos, only to end up trapped there all night when the storeaposs shutters locked him in. He could be heard pleading with passers-by for a cigarette as he banged on the shutters at .am on Feb th. And one man on his way to work found his pleas so hilarious he filmed him. Musician Ethan Brahney, , was walking through the city centre at .am when he heard the manaposs desperate cries. He realised they were coming from behind the shutters, which protect the main store windows of Wilkos in Lancaster. In Ethanaposs video, the stricken man can be heard banging on the metal doors.Ethan says: You alright mate  to which he replies: I canapost get out! Ethan replies: How did you get in there  and he replies: I fell asleep last night and someoneaposs locked me in! Ethan then says: Youaposve been locked in the shutter  and the man says: Yeah. Ethan then adds: Sh*t man Iaposll give Wilkos a call and seeanyoneaposs there. Hilariously the trapped partygoer then pleads: Have you got a cig on you mate  Cracking up, Ethan replies: Nah man, I donapost even know how Iaposd get it to you, thereaposs a f*cking grill in the way. I canapost even see you. That is f*cking class man. Heaposs stuck in the gutter, in the grill. Ahh I tell you what man you have just brightened my morning up with that. All the best brother. Ethan then continues on his way to work, laughing.  He said he didnapost call Wilkos as the store opened in  minutes and he knew the man would get rescued then. Wilkos Lancaster shuts at :pm, meaning the man must have been there for almost  hours. Ethan explained: I was going to work, Iaposve no idea about anything before I saw him. I assume heaposd just had a night on the drinks, fallen asleep and the shutters have come down automatically when the shop closed. Weaposve all had a rough night like that - you canapost blame the lad for wanting a kip. Iaposm not sure about how people didnapost see him because itaposs not asit was dead, there were a few people out and about. I Googled the number, but saw the store opened not too long after I was there. I thought of calling but thoughtthe shutters are down thereaposd be no one in as theyaposd have to open the shutters to access the store. I saw that the store was opening very soon after I found him and I had to get to work so I went. Obviouslyhe was in pain or discomfort I wouldaposve helped but he was chilling asking me for a fag. If the first question was more alarming than that I wouldaposve done more to help. I think heaposd just been on a night out, I thinkhe was homeless he wouldaposve had a spot thataposs more permanent. Iaposve no idea who the guy is, thataposs why Iaposm keeping the video up, the guyaposs anonymous so itaposs a funny video rather than a mocking one. Wilkos has been contacted for comment. news uk-news man-finds-hidden-tunnel-under-"London: Secret tunnel discovered beneath private gardensByZahna EklundAudience writerKatie Dollard:,  Feb |comments When you were younger, did you ever wish there was a secret tunnel underneath your house that connected with your best friendaposs house down the street  Well, it turns out those dream walkways do actually exist - and one estate agent in London has found one by accident. Luke McCarthy, from London, was showing a client a five-storey Regents Park townhouse when he came across the hidden find, which connects two of the houses on the street.The tunnel was located on Park Crescent, just off of Marylebone Road, which is a curving terrace of houses built between  and . Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. Across the road, there was meant to be another crescent that would form a circus, but financial problems during the first development meant the other half was never built and the land was named Park Square instead. In the centre of the circle, there was supposed to be a parish church but it instead became Park Crescent gardens. The houses were for the wealthy – andyou were rich enough to get your hands on one you would have exclusive access to the gardens in Crescent and Park Square, as well as a nursemaid to look after your children. But because of the busy road between the two areas, an underground tunnel was dug out in  to keep the children safe and for the nursemaids to use, giving the hidden space the name of aposNursemaidsapos Tunnelapos.  Luke, who is the director of Fine  Country Prime Central London, said: I found it during a showing with a client, it was quite fun! Itaposs the first time I’ve ever seen something like this. The tunnel connects both gardens and has sloping approaches which were perfect for prams and children, and it is still in use today - but because the gardens are private for residents of the wealthy street, the public rarely gets to see it. However, it is accessible to visitors during the annual Open Garden Squares weekend for London history lovers, which will take place this year on Saturday  and Sunday  June, .Do you have a story to sell  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror .Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON property newsViral" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts from our Property Market newsletterSubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news mans-shock-after-cctv-shows-"Connahs Quay: Delivery driver appears to attempt to open front doorByHarri EvansMichele Theil:,  Feb |comments A man was left shocked when a Hermes courier driver tried to enter his home to drop off a parcel after he didnapost answer the door. The resident watched the incident on his home CCTV camera at around noon last Friday , reports North Wales Live.He was in the bathroom of his three-bedroom home when he heard a knock at the door, followed immediately by the sound of the door handle being turned by the driver in question. The man, who wished to remain anonymous, said: I just think itaposs unusual. The Hermes delivery man pulled outside my house with a parcel, he walked up the drive, knocked the door, and then immediately pulled on the handle. I know what sound my front door makes when someoneaposs trying to open it. I was upstairs at the time in the bathroom and it was a bit of a shock.Have you had a similar encounter  Let us know at webnews@mirror He then ran from the bathroom to tell the driver to leave the parcel at the door. The resident added: I stuck my head out of a window to tell him. Iaposm not sure whether they should be doing it or not but it could be quite frighteningit was an elderly person living by themselves.  He added that the driver had his hood up which made it look like he was trying to hide [his] identity. He said: I sent a complaint to Hermes and they told me that the driver thought we had a porch and that he was trying to leave the parcel in it [a designated safe place]. However, the resident claried that they donapost have [a porch] and the door opens into [their] living room. EvenI did have a porch, I wouldnapost want people letting themselves in, he said. A spokesperson for Hermes said: We have raised this with the local team who have spoken to the courier involved. This was a genuine mistake as the courier believed it was a porch - we will ensure it wonapost happen again. title: meghan markle really upset kate
story: Meghan Markle really upset Kate Middleton in foot-stamping rant, author claimsRoyal author Tom Quinn described an alleged incident where Meghan Markle felt she was not being treated with the same respect as Kate Middleton while she and Prince Harry lived at Kensington PalaceMeghan allegedly felt she was not being treated with the same respect as Kate while she lived at the palace Image: PAByDimitris Kouimtsidis:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |commentsMeghan Markleaposs treatment of one of Kate Middletonaposs staffers during a “foot-stamping rant” at Kensington Palace left the Duchess “really upset”, a royal author has claimed.Tom Quinn, author of Kensington Palace: An Intimate Memoir from Queen Mary to Meghan Markle, has claimed palace insiders told him about an incident when Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, “lost her temper” at a staffer. Speaking to the Daily Star, Quinn described an alleged incident where Meghan felt she was not being treated with the same respect as Kate, Duchess of Cambridge, while she and husband Prince Harry lived at the Palace.Meghan and Harry were living in whataposs called Nottingham Cottage and itaposs probably the only bit that you genuinely really could say, is actually quite small,” Quinn said. And so, I think that reminded Meghan that she was, as it were, second place or as the runner-up.  So, when Harry and Will got together and sometimes Meghan and Kate as well because there was this tension occasionally, famously Meghan slightly lost her temper with a member of Kateaposs staff in front of Kate. And it was that incident, that I was told by someone who was actually there, who said it was really uncomfortable because Meghan just lost it with this person. The reason she lost it with Kateaposs member of staff was that she, Meghan, didnapost feel that this person was giving her the sort of attention she deserved. It was almost asin that one encounter, it encapsulated for Meghan the problem that she had, that sheaposs a Princess and sheaposs number two.  He added: She was very successful, coming into this alien environment where people behave towards you according to where you are in the status of who becomes King or Queen next, thataposs just alien to her. The way it was described to me was, there were raised voices and foot-stamping. It is further claimed that the incident left Kate feeling really upset. Mr Quinn continued: Meghan asked this person, I know who it was, but I canapost say because it will give away my source, who works for Kate who was basically asked to do something by Meghan and said, aposIaposm really sorry I canapost do that because I work for Kateapos. And Meghan really felt she had been slightly put in her place becauseyou become a Princess, you kind of assume that staff when you ask them to do something, they are going to do it. He added: Shewas horried, she was really upset because sheaposs very fond of this particular member of staff and she thought that Meghan almost bowling out this person was just completely unacceptable. Sheaposs very sensitive about not being treated with the same respect that she feels Kate is, so can react badly and doesnapost take it lying down. The Duchess of Sussex has been contacted for comment. title: mum shares photos child riddled
story: Mum shares photos of her child riddled with painful sores in warning about kissing kidsSadie Green,  months, was riddled with excruciating cold sores which made the poorly youngster "scream in agony" after being kissed on the lips by an adultLittle Sadie was in excruciating pain for several weeks Image: Leah GreenByAntony ThrowerNews Reporter:,  Feb |comments A mum whose young daughter suffered agonising cold sores has warned parents not to let adults kiss their babies.Little Sadie,  months, was unable to eat or drink for several days after contracting herpes simplex mouth infection which caused the outbreak of blistering sores on the inside of her mouth and tongue.Mum Leah Green shared painful-looking images of her daughter on her Instagram account as a warning to other parents.Leah wrote on @tinyheartseducation: “Listen  learn from my first hand experience why you shouldn’t kiss babies kids, especiallythey aren’t yours.When Sadie was approx  months old, she was kissed by an adult on the lips, transferring the horrendous cold sore virus.“She got two small spots on her lip then spiked a temp of C.Within hours the spots were spreading across her face and white spots formed in her mouth, which turned into this awful puss like stuff that was especially behind her teeth. The slightest touch would make the spots bleed and she would scream in agony. “This meant she couldn’t eat or drink, resulting in weight loss and dehydration.” The first time mum took her poorly daughter to the doctor who prescribed Panadol, but it took three weeks for the agonising sores to finally clear up.  She added: “She was absolutely miserable and stuck to my hip for four days straight! Just attempting to put her down made her scream! We went to the Dr to get cream for the spots on her lip but it really was a waiting game for it to clear up. Around the clock Panadol was the only thing helping. Being first time parents and seeing your child in so much pain was horric. “It was a very very long  weeks so I hope I can help people by spreading awareness.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON BabiesHealth" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily coronavirus briefing with all the news you need to know direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: national lottery voucher offer deal
story: Get a £ voucher* for the UKs best attractions using a National Lottery ticketYou can use a Lotto ticket to claim a £ voucher* to redeem when booking any one of hundreds of attractionsAdvertorialByDave MastersDigital Commercial Editor:,  Jan Updated:,  Feb Whether you’re eight or , exploring new places brings out the adventurer inside us all.And in the UK we’re spoiled for choice, with hundreds of incredible attractions to fire up the imagination.Thrill seekers of all ages will find adrenaline-filled rides at Zip World or Legoland. Those who prefer a more relaxing experience can enjoy autumn’s spectacular show of colours at venues like Kew Gardens, Cardf Castle or RHS Garden Bridgewater – a major horticultural project near Salford. History fans will adore a trip to the gothic ruins at Whitby Abbey, Warwick or Stirling Castle, while animal lovers can meet Ruby the red panda, born in July at Edinburgh Zoo, or three adorable tiger cubs at Highland Wildle Park. Click here toabout National Lottery Days Out and redeem your £ voucher*. And you can use a Lotto ticket purchased on or after October ,  to claim a £ voucher* to redeem when booking any one of hundreds of attractions. Not only will you enjoy a discounted day trip, you can feel proud that you’ve helped fund many of the tourist and heritage sites that make the UK unique. By playing The National Lottery, you raise £million for good causes every week.  National Lottery players have supported  of the top  most visited tourist attractions in the UK**, from castles to wildle parks, botanical gardens to museums and plenty of other fun stuff. Every adventure starts with a finger on a map. So where will yours land Highland Wildle Park: Meet animals from all over the worldGet up close to some endangered animals from the world’s mountains and tundra in the stunning setting of the Cairngorms National Park. From the comfort of your car you’ll encounter bison, elk and red deer – then visit the tigers and polar bears on foot using the park’s trails. Many nativeanimals are here too, including the capercaillie, European grey wolf, wolverine, lynx, Scottish wildcat and beavers. Cardf Castle: Enjoy a great day in history It has a history that stretches back to Roman times, a keep dating from the Norman Conquest, a spectacular moat and great views over the city that sits just beside it. Cardf Castle makes for one brilliant family day out. You’ll learn that it was once home to the world’s richest man, and was used as a giant air raid shelter during the Nazi bombardment of the city. Kids will love standing beside the huge replica trebuchet – a six-ton medieval weapon built for a movie that was filmed at the castle. After you’ve toured the building, stroll around its beautul grounds, or explore the city itself.Stonehenge: Explore this wonderful World Heritage Site Get close to this mysterious monument that dates back nearly , years. This awe-inspiring embodiment of human ingenuity offers a direct connection to our ancient past, and is a bucket-list destination for visitors around the world. Click here toabout the National Lottery Days Out and redeem your £ voucher*.  *Subject to availability. One voucher per person. + only. See NationalLotteryDaysOut for full TsCs.**Source: the Association of Leading Visitor Attractions, . title: new mum who bought 10
story: New mum who bought £ raffle ticket after husband forgot wins huge £.m mansionBecca Pott says she will never let husband Ben live down the fact that he forgot to buy their ticket but thankfully for the new parents she saved the day and they now have a stunning new homeBecca and Ben Pott nearly missed their big chance after he forgot to buy their ticket Image: Omaze   SWNSByEd CullinaneSam Elliott-GibbsReporter:,  Feb |comments A couple nearly blew the chance of winning a stunning £.million mansion after forgetting to buy a raffle tickle for the first time.But new mum Becca Pott got in quick to buy their £ ticket after it slipped husband Benaposs mind - and they are glad she came to the rescue. The competition regulars are now set to trade their small East London flat for the massive five-bedroom home in Ascot, Berkshire. Becca, who is on maternity leave after the birth of daughter Ava last summer, picked up a ticket for the Omaze Million Pound House Draw after Ben, , forgot. The win means Ava will now spend her first birthday in the stunning property, which boasts four bathrooms, three dressing rooms, a hot tub and a state-of-the-art kitchen.  Becca said: My husband had entered every Omaze Million Pound House Draw prior to this one, but somehow heaposd forgotten to enter on this occasion. Luckily I decided to buy a £ ticket bundle in January without him knowing after seeing the house on television, Iaposm never going to let him live this down! The house is incredible, weaposve been wanting to move to somewhere bigger since our daughter Ava was born, now sheaposll be having her first birthday in a mansion! Becca, a finance analyst, and Ben, an accountant, have been married for two years and had their first child Ava last summer.  The excited mum said: We didnapost have space for her grandparents to come and stay in our two-bedroom flat, but now they can have the entire third floor when they visit. This win is truly le changing for us, weaposll stay here and enjoy the house for the summer at least, but whatever we decide to do, we know Ava is set for le.  We think the partnership between Omaze and Cancer Research UK is fantastic as itaposs raising money to help the charity continue its incredible work. The couple found out theyaposd scooped the main prize when the team from Omaze paid a surprise visit to their flat. Ben was in a supermarket - so had to rush home to hear the good news. The new home has a large, pillared entrance porch which leads visitors into the spacious entrance hall complete with fireplace and lt.  All stamp duty and legal fees are covered, and the lucky couple have also been given £, in cash to help settle-in. They are free to either live in the house, rent it or sell it. As well as making Becca and Ben multi-millionaires, the draw has also raised vital cash for Cancer Research UKaposs le-saving work into the prevention, diagnosis and treatment of cancer. The innovative fundraising campaign with Omaze has provided Cancer Research UK with a donation of £,. title: noisy chatty tesco worker vows
story: Noisy and chatty Tesco worker vows not to speak to any customers for three monthsLee Clark, a dad-of-five who works in a branch of Tesco in Southend-on-Sea, says he will be giving the silent treatment to all customers and colleaguesHe has vowed not to speak to any customers for three months Image: Lee Clark Essex LiveByMichele Theil:,  Feb |commentsA Tesco worker has decided to not speak to any customers at work for the next three months. Lee Clark, who works in a branch of Tesco in Southend-on-Sea, says he will be giving the silent treatment to all customers and colleagues. Lee is usually noisy and chatty but his silence vow is for a very good cause. He is being sponsored to be silent while on sht to raise money for Cancer Research, British Heart Foundation, and Diabetes UK. The father-of-five started his silence at the beginning of January and will finish on April . Instead of speaking, Lee is communicating with flashcards, pens, and paper.Speaking to Manchester Evening News, Lee said: It could be quite draining because you try not to slip up and try to focus. It can be a horrible experience but, again, Iaposm lucky I can put myself in that position to help someone  and Iaposll happily do that every single time. Lee said that knowing he is doing something good for those charities gets him through it because it can be a very lonely place and can make him feel quite isolated. The Tesco worker has worked at the supermarket chain for  years, and this will be his th year doing a sponsored silence. He first decided to remain silent after being referred to as the singing man on the tills.  Lee raised £ for the Lennox Lewis Cancer Fund in that very first nine-hour silent sht. It was phenomenal because Iaposve never done anything like that in my le before, so it really got me. He said, It gave me the bug for fundraising as well. I just saw the response as well as the love and support it brought. Lee explained that people would come into his branch of Tesco to see him be silent and donate to the bucket, saying it was a brilliant experience. I saw the dference it makes to people and thataposs what I never experienced before. Youaposre helping someone and theyaposre helping you, there is no better feeling than that. He added: I love giving. Lee has participated and organised in over  charity events in the last  years, raising around £, for  dferent charities.  Tesco is very supportive of Leeaposs fundraising and supports his challenge on its social media s. He also believes it provides a sense of fun and laughter to his colleagues and shoppers. While working, Lee hangs a board around his neck to explain what he is doing and who he is raising money for. Itaposs my th one, so itaposs quite an achievement in that sense and no one gets bored of it. They love me being quiet.  But, some people think at first they heaposs being rude but quickly change their minds when they see the sign. Lee says this fundraising event is his worst one compared to others heaposs participated in because he gets frustrated that he canapost talk.  It is the worst thing in the world when you just want to blurt out and join in their conversation, he said. After his sht is over, he is happy to be able to speak because he loves talking. In addition to his sponsored silence, Lee will also be running the London Marathon and climbing Mount Kilimanjaro this year to raise money for charity. Anything you raise is something more than you had yesterday, so it doesnapost matter what you raise, Lee added. title: prince charles testing positive again
story: Prince Charles testing positive again reminds us Covid pandemic is not overPrince Charles has contracted Covid- for a second time. It is hoped he has not passed it on to the Queen. The Palace said she is not showing symptoms and she is expected to take daily testsPrince Charles has tested positive for Covid- for a second time Image: Getty ImagesopinionByVoice of the Mirror:,  Feb |comments We wish Prince Charles a speedy recovery from coronavirus.The fact he has contracted it a second time is a reminder the pandemic is far from over. Tens of thousands are still coming down with the virus every day and, just as Charles will hope he has not passed it on to the Queen, they too will worry about spreading it. So Boris Johnson must explain why he unilaterally decided to bring forward the end of all Covid restrictions. One member of SAGE has said they were blindsided by the decision even though it has implications for millions of people’s health. It is also noticeable that neither the Chief Medical Officer, Sir Chris Whitty, nor the Chief Scientic Adviser, Sir Patrick Vallance, have said whether they approve of the PM’s actions. People will rightly ask whether the Prime Minister is acting in the national interest or out of political expediency.  Fools rush in Everything must be done to prevent Russia from carrying out its threat to invade Ukraine. Vladimir Putin is playing a reckless and risky game by massing an estimated , Russian troops on the country’s border. The response from the West must be resolute and united. But there is a fine line between taking a firm stance against Russian aggression and inflaming an already delicate situation. Boris Johnson’s overblown rhetoric yesterday risked crossing that line. President Putin is deliberately testing the resolve of the West. Forcing him to back down requires careful and well-calibrated diplomacy, not cavalier comments and photo opportunities designed to distract attention from domestic troubles. LveYu Sending flowers and writing love letters have fallen out of fashion. Now love means sharing your streaming password and compiling a Spoty playlist. news uk-news queens-dogs-pampered-lives-tailored-"Queen Elizabeth inspects Platinum Jubilee art submissionsByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Feb |comments If thereaposs one thing thataposs been a constant during the Queenaposs -year reign - itaposs her pet dogs.The corgi-loving monarch has taken care of countless pooches throughout the years, with one royal author claiming the only time she truly relaxes is when she is surrounded by the animals.Although sadly many of her dogs have passed away, she still has two corgis - one is called Muick - and a dorgi called Candy, who made an appearance in a recent photo of Her Majesty.She is also the proud owner of a champion gundog - a cocker spaniel called Lissy, who recently won the st Kennel Club Cocker Spaniel Championship, seeing off  competitors to gain the top spot. And as you can imagine being a pet of the Queen comes with serious perks as they lead lives that other dogs could only dream of. Hereaposs what their pampered lives entail... Menu of dishes It will come as no surprise that the Queenaposs dogs also have only the very best when it comes to their meal times.As well as meticulously checking what the royal household will be eating each week, the Queen also reportedly insists her beloved corgis have their own menus. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up. Former royal chef Darren McGrady said: They corgis have their own menu. One day theyaposll have lamb, one day beef and then another, chicken. We had to make sure that all the meat was cut very finely and diced so there were no bones because we couldnapost have them choking. Special gravy  If it sounds like the dogsapos food is quite dry fear not - they also have a special gravy that is poured on top of their food to make it even more delicious.And whataposs more, itaposs a special recipe that Her Majesty has created herself. In the book All The Queenaposs Corgis, author Penny Junor writes that the petsapos food is a iety of fresh, cooked meat, vegetables and rice, prepared specially for them in the royal kitchens, topped with a little biscuit, homoeopathic and herbal remedies when required, and a special gravy that, legend has it, is the Queenaposs own recipe. Feeding ritual  But youaposd be mistakenyou think the food is just put into bowls and the pets head in for a free-for-all. What actually happens at feeding time, is a strict ritual.Dr Roger Mugford, an animal psychologist who has worked for the royal household for decades, described witnessing the dogsapos dinner time at Buckingham Palace.He told Town and Country magazine: Their food was served by a butler in an eclectic collection of battered silver and porcelain dishes. As I watched, the Queen got the corgis to sit in a semi-circle around her, and then fed them one by one, in order of seniority. The others just sat and patiently waited their turn. While in her book, Penny Junor adds: Whenever possible, she [the Queen] feeds them herself and it is an afternoon ritual but not an unruly frantic free-for-all. A footman brings the food and bowls on a silver tray and lays out a plastic sheet to protect the carpet. The Queen then sits them in a semi-circle around her and does the rest.Travelling in style With the Queen having houses up and down the UK, she often has to travel with her dogs seemingly tagging along with her. But they donapost seem to be packed up in the back of a car. Charming snaps from over the years have shown the Queen sitting with the pets on her lap while in the car. In addition, the dogs have been a familiar sight at the likes of Aberdeen Airport, where the royals fly into on their way to the Balmoral estate in the Scottish Highlands.  Impressive sleeping quartersWhen it comes to bedtime, the Queenaposs dogs donapost just head to dog baskets in the kitchen - they actually have their own quarters.According to Hello!, when at Buckingham Palace, the dogs have their own spacious room where they sleep in raised wicker beds.In addition, the beds have fresh sheets put on them daily, which is said to be a tradition started by the Queen Mother. news uk-news queens-unusual-hobby-earned-more-"Queen and Prince Charles share a hobby reveals expertByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |commentsThe Queen may be extremely busy with ious royal engagements, duties and responsibilities, but thereaposs one hobby that sheaposs always made time for.While sheaposs been known to ride horses and take part in Scottish dancing, she also likes to collect stamps - and itaposs reportedly earned her a fortune over the years . The Monarch has been collecting stamps for decades and she now has an extremely impressive private collection with several that are worth a pretty penny.According to The , the Mauritian stamp is not only the most valuable in her collection but itaposs one of the most prized in the world and was valued at a staggering £ million back in .Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm.Click here to sign up.It originally belonged to her grandfather King George V, who bought it at auction in  for £, at the time - equivalent to about £, today. The stamp went on display to the public in  as part of a travelling exhibition to celebrate the Queenaposs Golden Jubilee. Over the years, the Queen has built an impressive collection, which is said to fill about  albums and about  boxes, all stored in a vault at St Jamesaposs Palace. Queen Victoria’s second son, Prince Alfred, started the stamp collection in . He then sold it to his brother, the future King Edward VII, who in turn gave it to his son, King George V and it subsequently passed down to King George VI and finally to the Queen.  When the Queen took over the collection she decided to sell some of the surplus to requirement stamps at auction and used the cash to buy new additions.According to the , the pieces she sold were a huge hit with buyers back in  and her  items made £,.She spent £, of the profit on a unique set of  Penny Blacks.Royal expert Phil Dampier told The Sunthat she loves to show them off to visitors when they come to see her at Buckingham Palace.He said: The Queen loves showing her stamp collection to visitors, say heads of state who stay at Buckingham Palace. It is one of her pride and joys, not only because she owns some of the world’s most valuable stamps, but also because she has built on a family treasure and feels she has done her father and previous monarchs who owned it proud.
